utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello, everyone. I'm Dana Perino along with Dagen McDowell, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City. And this is “The Five.” Majors revelations from the Attorney General William Barr about the investigation into how the Russia probe started. In his first interview since the Mueller report was released, Barr is saying he is not satisfied with the early answers he is getting on allegations of Trump campaign spying.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAM BARR, ATTORNEY GENERAL
utterances.utterance: I've been trying to get answers to questions and I found that a lot of the answers have been inadequate and I've also found that some of the explanations I've got don't hang together. So, in a sense, I have more questions today than I did when I first started. So, I think people have to find out what the government was doing during that period. If we are worried about foreign influence for the very same reason, we should be worried about whether government officials abused their power and put their thumb on the scale. And so, I'm not saying that happened. But I am saying that we have to look at that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Barr also commenting on the Steele dossier.

utterances.speaker: BARR
utterances.utterance: It's a very unusual situation to have opposition research like that, especially one that on its face had a number of clear mistakes and someone jejune analysis and to use that to conduct counter-intelligence against American political campaign is a strange -- would be a strange development. I'm not sure what role it played. But that's something we have to look at.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, Greg, I have a theory. You don't want me to go to you first?

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.utterance: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. So, my theory is that if you were in the Obama administration at the time of the 2016 election and you were aware of Russian interference and you were somehow -- it would seem to me that you would welcome an investigation into the investigation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What do you think of that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Absolutely. But you may have heard a phrase that I coined recently. What's good for the goose is good --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: For the gander.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No for my Uncle Steve. What's good for the goose is good for my Uncle Steve. He lives in the basement.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How is he doing by the way?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No well. I feed him lettuce and insects, he's like a goose. The Dems and the media have spent two years doing this. Do you think that they are just going to let it go now? They're going to cap that. Now this is revenge time. This is like evening the -- evening the score. And you can use the same argument. You could say like we know that the Russians tried to collude. We know that the Russians tried to meddle. Now we need to know how it was done and who helped them. It's the same argument in reverse. And the dossier, the great dossier it's like a bad batch of egg salad serve to -- serve at the buffet and everyone who took a taste got food poisoning. It's the food poisoning of the news. That's why CNN is so blue in the face all the time because they took the, you know, the biggest helping.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.utterance: That's why if someone gave you food poisoning, you'd be mad at them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But CNN is not mad. And to your point, if you were lied to by the Obama intelligence officials about collusion for two years and they humiliated you, you got a nice ratings bump but then at the end they humiliated you. The ratings are taking a nose dive. Wouldn't you want to know why and how you were lied to? It seems like they have no interest in finding out what went wrong with the collusion hoax? But they don't care. Now, to your point about the Steele dossier and the FISA warrant, we are learning a lot and more about that. So, the whole FISA warrant on Carter Page looks like it was based off the Steele dossier. A major red flag in the Steele dossier, it said that they were running this operation through Carter Page out of the Russian embassy in Miami. There is no Russian embassy in Miami. Anyone that could look at that would know immediately that's a red flag.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Is there a consulate office?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No. In Tampa. Not even in Miami. So, they also said the other two reasons they set in for the warrant, was two meetings that Carter Page had with these Russians oligarchs to hatch this plot. Both meetings never happened and then they used a Yahoo news article. Then you have Papadopoulos. We're now learning that this is really not really what started off the entire investigation and that's going to come out. He never even spoke to a Russian. And we have now text messages between Strzok and Page. Strzok and Page called Mifsud, the guy that started this whole thing their guy. Now if he is a Russian agent how is he their guy? Very, very suspicious.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Juan, if I can continue on with my theory. So if you are Hillary Clinton and you really believe that this election was stolen from you because the Russians interfered, wouldn't you also want it to be revealed like how the -- if you believe that that's true and you believe that the Obama administration did the right thing, wouldn't it be a good thing for her argument for the people to be able to see what the origins of the investigation were?

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.utterance: Right, but that's not what's going on here, Dana. What's going on is an investigation of the investigators as punishment coming from an administration --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Punishment.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- that is overwhelmingly political. I mean, right now, really, they are distracting from the real news with all of the silliness. Because the real news is that we're going to will soon see transcripts of what Michael Flynn's and Michael Flynn's lawyers were saying to Trump's lawyers. And we'll see just how much they were trying to stop this investigation. But the second thing to say here, is listening to Bill Barr, I mean, he has no reason to do anything. But what he says, you know what, let's not talk about the spying. I know I said that earlier. What about what happened between the time Trump was elected and the time he takes office. Let's go and look at what happened in terms of FBI and intelligence agencies talking to Trump at Trump tower. Did they leak something? He just changes the game time and again. And that's why --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's added --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: NO.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- added things to look at.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's why when you look at the Fox News poll that came out yesterday, the Fox News polls says 45 percent of Americans believe that Barr is covering up for Trump and not being transparent. And also, they give him a negative rating for how he handled the Mueller report. Forty- four percent say they don't approve of what he has done with the Mueller report. Only 35 percent --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That feels like a pretty --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The media destroyed the --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If that makes you feel better but it has no effect on anything.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's the truth. The truth. In other words, the American --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. It's a poll. It's a poll.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The American people are not being hoodwinked by a guy who is now Trump's lawyer. This is what Trump wished for all along. He wanted an attorney general --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- who would be his consigliere and that's what this guy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Like his wing man. Like Holder was for Obama.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, not like Holder. Holder --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, wait, what's happening right now the Russian story is now into its summer reruns. That's what happening. I saw it on the first run. I don't need to see it again. I know what this Flynn story is about. I know all that crap. That's because the economy is going well. The world is going pretty, it's peaceful. It's prosperous. Everything is fine. They have to keep doing the Russian story.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Jess, look, people don't look --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Can I add one other thing here?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- says Greg. Don't look here. Look --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't care --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm going to get --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We already looked for two years.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Now we are looking in the other direction.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The White House talking point is this investigation is done. No obstruction and no collusion. Jerry Nadler has said to them repeatedly this is about --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I have a point about that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- preventing the Russians from doing it again.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Can I play -- can you please -- guys, can we please get Dagen? But first, can we hear the attorney general about this idea about the documents and contempt.

utterances.speaker: BARR
utterances.utterance: It's part of the usual game, you know, political circus that's being played out. It doesn't surprise me.

utterances.speaker: BILL HEMMER, ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: The House Speaker Nancy Pelosi she believes you lied under oath. What do you think of that charge?

utterances.speaker: BARR
utterances.utterance: Well, I think it's a laughable charge. And I think it's largely being made to try to discredit me. Partly because they may be concerned about the outcome of a review of what happened during the election.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Dagen?

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, HOST
utterances.utterance: They are trying to discredit him because they are worried, people who worked in the Obama administration and the FBI and the CIA and the intelligence community, they are worried. Whether it's Brennan or Comey or even subordinates of both of them. They are worried about what Bill Barr and John Durham and the Inspector General Michael Horowitz are going to find. It's not silliness, Juan if there was corruption. It's not silliness if there is an abuse of power. And you know why Hillary Clinton is being quiet about this? Because the DNC and Hillary Clinton's campaign paid for that dossier. What could be disinformation by Russia which was, if you read the whole Mueller report, the whole Mueller report, basically discredits big, big elements that were in that dossier. And I just want to point this out. I point it out all the time. Jim Comey looked at Bret Baier in the spring of last year and said I can't definitely say I know that the Steele dossier was paid for by the DNC and the Clinton campaign. He was running the FBI. They got a warrant on an American citizen to spy on him and he didn't know that. That is boulder dash and hog wash and -- we all know it. And by the way, I also read that poll, Juan. And here's what people said. A majority 58 percent think it is at least somewhat likely the FBI broke the law when it started investigating the Trump campaign.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: The millions of Americans who don't trust what went on in intelligence and the FBI under the Obama administration. They deserve answers.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: And there is nothing wrong with a thorough look at it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They had it.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Because again, it disrupts democracy in this country.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They had a thorough look. What we are doing now is we're trying to punish the investigators.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Mueller didn't look at it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Mueller didn't look at it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, Juan, you don't like --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Bill Barr said that I read the whole Mueller report.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Mueller didn't look --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: He did not look at the investigators and the predicate of that investigation.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You don't need Mueller. Pick up a newspaper. It will tell you how it started.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes. The press that lied to us for three years about Russia?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Get out of here.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Liars. All.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know what, I'll save it for another day.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Because we have our favorite topic. New York City's Mayor de Blasio facing widespread mockery after his presidential announcement. We'll show you next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: New York City's Bill de Blasio getting mocked from all sides after announcing he is running for president. Here's just a sample for you.

utterances.speaker: WHOOPI GOLDBERG, CO-HOST, ABC
utterances.utterance: Is this a good career move for him right now? No!

utterances.speaker: GOLDBERG
utterances.utterance: What are you doing?

utterances.speaker: GOLDBERG
utterances.utterance: It's not a good career move, man.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Bill de Blasio is the answer to what question that isn't being answered?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Unclear. I love -- God bless the New York Post this morning. New Yorkers laughing on the cover. This is probably a better America.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: On the inside.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You've been warned.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You've been warned.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Guys, after 12 years today was the final episode of the big bang theory. Yes. Don't worry, it was also the beginning of a brand-new comedy. Bill de Blasio's presidential campaign.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: President Trump joining in all of that by calling de Blasio a joke and, quote, "the worst mayor in the United States." De Blasio, though, quickly responding.

utterances.speaker: MAYOR BILL DE BLASIO, D-NYC, PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: Hey, con Don, I saw your video. Man, you looked really low energy. You know, I really think you better rest up because you're going to need it for the election ahead. We are coming for you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Dagen, does that mean Trump wants to run against de Blasio. Why is he sitting on Air Force One doing that video?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Because he like -- he enjoys like ridiculing him as every American does. He's -- you know why he is getting a lot of attention? He is a joke. People are mocking you. And you're not going to change that with a couple of zingers. So how does it feel to be laughed at, Mr. Mayor? Just mercilessly by all the American people. And by the way, this is a little blue, literally unfigurative. But con Don sounds like condom. You know what, and that's something that gives you protection and provides safety. It might be uncomfortable and you might not like it but you know what? That's a stupid nickname.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think we'll move on. I mean, come on.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: No, I'm serious. He can't even -- he's got no mojo. People around the country are going to be looking at him going, this guy takes a caravan of vehicles to go to the gym every morning. You spend an hour and a half to travel to 12 miles. Son, what in the hell is the matter with you? That's what people are going to be asking.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We can say that about a lot of politicians. Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: If you were Joe Biden, and I want you to take a look at these poll numbers. What would you be thinking right now?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If I was Joe Biden, I'd sniff your hair like this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Thank you, love. Thank you. What do you think, because his -- Biden has increased his lead now. As you can see, 35. He is up from March. Sanders has dropped some. Sanders is down six while Biden is up four. And Elizabeth Warren and Pete Buttigieg are both up 5 percent since March.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. I'm very impressed with Warren and Buttigieg. It looks like they've capitalized different ways. Buttigieg has capitalized mostly through being propelled by the media and just being a genuinely comfortable guy in his own skin. The Warren trajectory I don't get. You know, I'm not on the campaign trail so I don't quite understand it. I just think she is slowly and methodically making connections to people on the ground in early states and she's resonating. So good for her. Obviously, Sanders is going to kind of take a gut punch when Biden officially announces. He was taking a lot of that front runner space. But I really do believe the comment he made about the Boston bomber may have hurt him. I think it would. Because his backers are so crazy. But I think moderate Democrats saw that and were completely dejected by. And then just lastly Biden, I still believe there is a chance he gets the nomination. I think he is an empty suit.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You do?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. So, Dana, also I want you to look at these numbers. This is the general election. Biden would beat Trump by 11 points. It's up from seven points in March. Also, Sanders and I think it's Elizabeth Warren would beat Trump right now. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, I think that what's probably happening there. Remember, Hillary Clinton won the popular vote. So that's probably the same thing happening here. So, the question is still the electoral college. Brad Parscale, the camp -- Trump campaign manager on Fox and Friends this morning you can look that they tweeted that out. You could look it up. And he's explaining that the electoral college don't makes sense for them. And he's actually saying that they can expand the map. But let's just even say that they didn't. If President Trump wins Florida, Wisconsin, and Arizona, he gets to 270. That's what you need for the electoral college. So even if Pennsylvania and Michigan swing back to the Democrats --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: President Trump still wins in the electoral college. Which I think it's going to be -- I think it will be a close race. But nobody should count out either side. But to pass to 270 for President Trump looks pretty good.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: By the way, Greg, so you think that we have to charge Trump for this trip because he is making political videos on Air Force One?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, not if you are doing an official event at the same time.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, but he is doing politics.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Dana. You read my mind.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He is doing politics.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Read my mind. Thank you. You look down on my notes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Answer for that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And she's cheating. She's cheating.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Remember, according to polls Donald Trump was the only person up on the Republican stage that was supposed to lose to Hillary. So, these don't mean anything. What I find interesting --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: If I get -- those are the popular vote when -- that's why that was my point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That if you -- don't worry about that. Think about the electoral college.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would just recast it in a different way, Dana. Don't get so testy. All right. Whoopi Goldberg -- Whoopi Goldberg, she is a liberal who lives under the worst kind of liberal. So, I can live under a liberal. The worst kind of liberal is a de Blasio liberal which doesn't -- in New York City it doesn't allow for the opposing party to sit at the table. Right? Because I will say I think if conservatives need liberals and liberals need conservatives, they're both yin and yang. And that's how you get the best outcomes because it challenges your ideas. It puts your ideas to the test. And for some reason, you can end up in the center and come up with some good ideas. The problem is all you have in New York City, it's a one-party system, it's a one party everything. And nobody bothers to vote. Nobody bothers to care. And what you end up with there's a pretty crappy place in terms of crappy literally. And I do think it's brutal hearing de Blasio take credit for crime stats. Those are a gift from the law enforcement that he hates and hog-ties. That's got to drive police officers crazy. I mean, this is a gift from two Republican mayors and the police officers that worked under them in the current -- in the current administration.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that like Obama's economy?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It doesn't work anymore.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I get it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, Juan, that would have worked for a couple months, but it's tree years now.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Can I just add to what you just said about New Yorkers expecting basic levels of services. New York liberals are used to good subway systems and clean streets. And when you have someone come in and destroy the basic necessities that they've gotten used to under Rudy Giuliani and Michael Bloomberg, that's going backwards for them. I think that's one of the reasons they've soured on this guy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Do you know that the governor is in charge of the subway and not the mayor?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I understand that but also Penn station outside the subway, it's more than just that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I just think that, you know, when you look at Bill de Blasio, I don't understand the reason for his candidacy. I think most Democrats don't understand why this guy is running. And that's -- we talked about Elizabeth Warren. She has that income inequality issue. She has proposals.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I'll tell you what I heard really quickly. I heard and read in multiple places that the mayor is bored. Yes. He's bored with his job. He hates his job.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He's outgrown it.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: And he wants to get out of New York City.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I agree. He wants to get out of here.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: And I guess the headline would be mayor has no soul. He feel that way --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELF
utterances.utterance: So, because he's bored, he's going to make us suffer.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, you know, remember though, he is the guy that wanted to bring Amazon here. And it was people on the left.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's true. Good point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. OK. But however, then when they left, then he tried to hide behind AOC as well. He tried to have it both ways.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Where he blends in her -- OK.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I think it was not good leadership.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Up next, is President Trump about to follow-through on his threat to send illegal immigrants to sanctuary cities. We're going to fill you in on that next on THE FIVE.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: It looks like President Trump may be ready to make good on his threat to dump illegal immigrants into Democratic cities. The Trump administration is reportedly preparing to release thousands of migrants caught at the border into Florida's Democratic strongholds. Local politician they are saying about 1,000 migrant families will be sent to Broward and Palm Beach counties each month for an unknown period of time. U.S. customs officials just saying they are not currently sending migrants to Florida but they are looking at possible locations across the country. Jesse, this is a crisis. You had a record number of apprehensions of parents traveling with children just last month. These people have to go somewhere. Is something wrong with this?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, where are they going to go? No one wants them. People on the right don't want them, people on the left don't want them. De Blasio said yes, we are a big sanctuary city, but he was offered illegal immigrants he said no, I'm going to fight it. San Francisco, Pelosi's town didn't want it either. Remember, that was considered payback. Greg made that point. Why is it payback if we're supposed to like these people. They don't want them on the border Texas towns. They don't want them south of the border in the northern Mexican border towns. Listen, if Palm Beach and Broward are Democrat counties but Florida is a red state, it's a swing state. Republican governors, Republican senators. Both parties have no infrastructure to handle these people. And I don't think any of the local people want them either because it's going to crush their local economy. Where do you put them you? Where do you out them? The only solution is you keep the, you hold them, you extend the settlements so you could hold the families together. Process them. Use more judges and then send them back if their asylum claims don't add up.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: let me just quickly something up though. These are not sanctuary cities.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Right. You read my mind.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, I mean, so in other words --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But New York City and San Francisco are.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no. But what we got on the table, Jesse, is he said he is going to dump them. And by the way, is this cruel? Talk about bad government. He is just going to dump people in a vengeful act. I mean, that --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wait, Juan, where would you like the federal government to put these people?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're using the word dump.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Where would you like them to go?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'll tell you The Catholic Church. And I just want to say, you know, Catholic Church we always talk about the Catholic Church. The Catholic Church has been terrific.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Terrific in the border --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, there's hundreds of illegal immigrant families coming in every hour.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm just telling you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And you think the Catholic Church can take all of them?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. What I'm saying. You hit something on the head early when you talked about a lack of infrastructure in Broward and Palm Beach. By the way, maybe they could go to Mar-a-Lago because Trump apparently hires illegals.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: All right. Greg --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There is no -- there is no infrastructure, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I'm telling you the church is actually putting in place structures to try to welcome people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The thing is --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The church can't hold them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A lot of people want these people but they want it through a process. And we don't have a process. Now, if you look at President Trump's plan. It's pretty interesting the two things. One is a very simple question that he is asking opposed to Americans and the answer is pretty simple. Who would you want to control of your immigration? Your country or the world. Until you have a process the world controls your immigration. Whoever sends the caravans controls your immigration. That's wrong. It has to be our country. We control the border. That's the first thing. The second thing is, he's transformed it into a competitive thing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He is saying, look, Canada, New Zealand, Australia, Japan already emphasized employment skills way more than anybody else - like 60 percent, 50 percent they weigh employment heavily - employment skills heavily. So now he's turning this into a competitive race to get the best and the brightest to the country, that's a really positive thing and I think that that's going to make it harder to argue against his plan. But the first part is who makes the decisions our country should. And I would stop using the word dump, when you're talking about people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Me too.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: President Trump didn't use the word dumped, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. First, I think that the President offered a couple of ways yesterday in his Rose Garden speech to change the asylum laws and also to - so that people can comply in their country or whatever. But also he would change the law so that people from the Northern Triangle countries are treated such as Canada and Mexico. That seems fair to me. That sounds like a common-sense balanced thing that people should be allowed - would be willing to vote for. The other thing is you can solve our problems here, we also know that they're going to keep coming. Right, so there's the pressure on the border and we haven't talked about solving the problem at its source, because that's the only way that it's going to stop. People are not going to stop leaving. They're going to leave. But you look at people that trying to leave Syria, they'll do anything to get out of there, desperate people do desperate things. So in the long run, I think, there's something need to--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But to - to help those countries, but also you have to - you have to be realistic and real about who's coming. There are economic migrants and then there are people who are desperate and right now we have politicians who just throw that throw them into one big package.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, which is why--

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: We got to go.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hang on a second, I just don't understand, though, when the President talks about bad hombres, again it sounds like he's just talking about people south of the border --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: We got to go.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: --when they're not even the biggest source of illegal immigrants.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Literally some bad hombre, we know that.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Final word. Up next the unreal reason a lunch lady was fired and an epic slide in Spain and why Game of Thrones could cause millions of Americans to call out sick on Monday, all that in the "Fastest 7", next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. Time for the "Fastest 7". First up, hard to believe situation at a high school in New Hampshire after a lunch lady says she was fired for giving a student a free lunch with only $8. Bonny Kimball says she was accused of theft by the food vendor and also claims she asked the teen to pay his debt, which was settled the very next day. Two workers quit and protests, but the food provider says the information provided and reported is untrue, although they didn't really specify. I love lunch ladies, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. You know what I am going to take a unpopular stance on this, because I don't really believe the story completely. She should have gotten in trouble. And by the way $8 is a lot of money. Only $8 is a lot of money. Look, talk to any bar owner or watch any episode of "Bar Rescue", the thing that kills the business is people giving away free booze.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wait - but Greg, he got to pay it back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's easy for a - I'm just trying to make an argument. Easy for a bartender to be generous if he doesn't pay for the booze. So she wasn't giving away her food, she was giving away the school's food, she should be arrested and put away for 10 years. Lock her up and the child needs to go away to camp - summer camp - a fun camp.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dana, I feel like you have a different point of view her.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I feel for her and also for the boy, right, because it's not easy if you - and if you're broke, right? But what I do think is interesting, she took that risk, she allowed him to do that. And then if you do that you often do get paid back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And he - they paid it back the next day.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, I wonder if it was one of those Michelle Obama lunches, because those aren't even worth $8.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I love how you brought the Obamas into this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I don't even know what Michelle Obama--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And then there is - it's like mystery meat or like no meat one of those things everyone hated them.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't know, I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, we covered it at Fox flip years.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, it's a good thing I didn't go to the cafeteria. But I just felt for her and I noticed that two of her colleagues quit in support of her. But then it - apparently part of the story is that the food service had a competitor come in and was looking at the school that day and they were worried that the school district was going to give the business to the competitor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know there was a--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There's something else going on here. That's a good point. What about you Dagen?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: This is what we are these days. We punish good people. Tater Tots forever, I don't care--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I love tater tots.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. This next one looks like a lot of fun. Check it out.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God. This Spanish town built a slide to cut down on the just 10 minute walk between the two streets--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's amazing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It was forced to shut it down after only 24 hours due to injuries. I mean, before I saw the video I thought it was pretty weak. But I mean they were careening pretty hard of slides. Look at that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I've been proponent of slides as transportation since I was a kid. There was a toy store in San Mateo, California at the Hillsdale Mall, called Bell Arts (ph) and they used to have a slide that went from the first floor down into the basement. It was great until Billy died. But the thing is - and then Tommy and then Caitlin - maybe they just disappeared.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, rest in peace.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, but slides are great.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What a great idea. It's a shame that people got injured.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's a great idea conceptually and then when someone breaks a limb --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is infrastructure week Spanish style. The thing is it's a little steep and --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, that what really--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I'm not sure if they did a lot of testing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I'm with you. I mean, it looks--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The engineering on this slide --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because it looks stupid, it's just too steep that's not reasonable. I mean, you say maybe _5 have fun. But it's like you go to the - there's summer is coming up and you go on a waterslide. I mean that's a steep - that's like for the big boys.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --gnarly left turn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And only one at a time there's no fun.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly. I wish they'd left it up for more than 24 hours so we had kind of weeks of video to watch. As long as nobody gets seriously injured like a little bit hurt, I'm cool with that. And you know teenage boys were running home to put on their slickest track pants--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: --to get as much speed going down that thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I love it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. If you're thinking about skipping work on Monday over Game of Thrones, well, you're not alone. A survey has found that estimated 10 million Americans are expected to call out "Sick" following the much- anticipated series finale on Sunday. Do you even watch Game of Thrones?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I've watched some of it. If you worked for me and called in sick due to a poorly written TV fantasy drama, I wouldn't just fire you. I would burn your entire town down. I would burn everybody in the town down--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: With the dragon--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --with the dragon, just like they did a Game of Thrones. I had an idea. They should do - you get to trade jobs with people sometimes. They should get the writers of Veep to write Game of Thrones and then the writers a Game of Thrones not do any writing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's one way to do it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And also if you're going to call in sick on Monday, don't tweet about it the night before about Game of Thrones, because you will get caught.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Very good --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I would be more likely to support Super Bowl Monday then Game of Thrones Monday.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, so would I. Well Greg you won't be here on Monday, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Of course--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hey, you busted my man. He's got--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --he loves - big Game of Thrones fan over here.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: --because I was going to defend you. But I - all right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think there's interesting thing going on here, because I think people are upset with Game of Thrones, because the good lady has turned out to be a bad lady and they want the whole thing redone. You know what this is Greek mythology. People who are hungry for power always turn out to go over the top and get themselves revealed as, you know what, having blind ambition. So you got to have to live with it folks.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: It's not Greek mythology. It's not Knots Landing with incest. That's all it is and you stole my answer - punishment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, some really good analysis here on “The Five” today. "Fan Mail Friday" up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "Fan Mail Friday", let's get to your questions. I like this question a lot but Cheryle C. "As a child what did you think would be awesome about being an adult, but isn't as awesome as you thought it would be? That's a really great and profound question, Dagen?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Men.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wow, that's - God, that's a great answer actually.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I'm not going to expand on that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's just the opposite sex or it doesn't have to be, I guess, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait, you're saying when you were a little girl--

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I just thought it would be awesome, it's like going dates and like - and it kind of never happened.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, stop. Your husband was a great date obviously.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Two husbands.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. I give up.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Not simultaneous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, man. I love this segment. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I mean, when you're a kid it looks like the adults have power and right have money so they have control you think, Oh one day I want - I can get decide what I want to get up, when I want to go to bed, what I eat. And then when you actually have power, you realize you have to earn the power, you have responsibility. If you make mistakes people blame you. You think, oh, geez.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So worth it. What about you Jesse, you're a child at heart.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. When you're younger and you can't go on the rides at fairs --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I'm still at that point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --yes, you know. And then at my age when you finally are tall enough to get there, it hurts.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Or it makes you sick.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --and you know it's not as fun.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have great problems. Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I would say bossing people around is not as fun. I was going to say decision-making. Like, you think that if you're the decider everything's going to be great. And like, oh shoot, I just wish somebody would make decisions for me a couple time--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Every time you got - every year that you got older and went to something new, you realize how much how - many more choices you had. And you just wanted to be that young kid again where you didn't have to think about anything.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Choices are hard.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Choices are hard. That'll be the title of my new book - Choices are hard. And I'll co-write it with doctor - any doctor.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Any doctor call me we'll write a book together. All right. "If the President gave you a nickname what would you hope it would be? Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: "Dirty Watters".

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He thought of this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's a good one.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You had that one ready to do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It was like - yes.

utterances.utterance: Greg.

utterances.utterance: "Giant Killer". And I took a picture with Brad Parks - he's 6'8. I looked like a ridiculous human next to him. He's quite tall.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't know, (inaudible) he calls me childish. I don't appreciate it. But he stopped tweeting about you, so I appreciate that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dagen?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: "Big Dagen".

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's "Big Dagen".

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Some of that being true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.utterance: From a neck down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just want to be - I know he watches - so he just tweeted me "Sexy Greg".

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Little Greg, too deep.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: You have to do this when you say that.

utterances.utterance: Yes, yes. No, I don't even need to do that. This is good question. This is from Henry. "How do you all react to an autograph request?" I know Dana you pretty much - you'll throw hot coffee on someone's face--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes I scream. I go mad. I'm just like - you know what, it's a big honor to be asked for your autograph.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is. It really is. And you know this question is from somebody a little bit older Jesse --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because nobody does this.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.utterance: Dana don't carry around the pen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can sign things on people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, thank you. Dagen.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Your big time enough, you need to start are carrying around a sharpie with you everywhere, that's what NASCAR drivers do. They always have a sharpie for autographs.

utterances.utterance: Is that a knife?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK. That's what I call my knife - sharpie.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL

And I'm like, "Hey, let's go get breakfast" "Let's go have lunch". And they feel like I'm being overly cumbersome (ph) and it kind of makes them a little frightened.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But the - so but - another day I got a request for good money actually to sign like a 1,000 books and they're going to be leather-bound editions of a book I wrote almost 30 years ago.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was leather-bound once. You know--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God, that'll be your nickname.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, leather bound Greg. You know what I do. I always, if it's an older gentleman or gentlewoman I will sign it as Brian Kilmeade and then I'll swear at him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I was going in the subway the other day and the guy walks by me goes, "Hey, love you on Fox & Friends". I think he thought I was Kilmeade.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think it wasn't - that was Duecy who said that. Duecy was on the subway.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's where he rides.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's how he rides.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "One More Thing" is up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.utterance: Passed away. This is the internet's most famous feline. While her rise to stardom led to high-end sponsorships, appearances on the silver screen and earnings of - get this a $100 million. She was best known for the meme that started it all. I think we have picture of it. I had fun once, it was awful. Since her passing, everyone's been pouring in tributes to this cat. She was only seven. She died in the arms of her mother Tabitha and it was due to complications from a urinary tract infection. You go to check those things out. Anyway Grumpy Cat, a $100 million, I wish I could have figure that out. You still have time with Rookie, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

What is the name he has given to the South Bend Mayor Pete Buttigieg? Kennedy? LISA KENNEDY MONTGOMERY, HOST "KENNEDY": Alfred E. Neuman.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Alfred E. Neuman?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Alfred E. Neuman.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. Notice what she said - was it Alfred P. Neuman, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Or is it Alfred E. Neuman?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She should have said "E", but she said "P".

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Alfred E. Neuman is the correct answer. That was the tiebreaker. That would have given me that victory.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They don't - I'm telling you they do not keep score well on that show.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You do not run a very tight--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I saw their two producers the other day said, "Hey, haven't you noticed I've been on your show in a while".

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'd like to be invited back, because I just need to do it once.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You want to redo rematch.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Can I faceoff against an intern here or something like that. Also "Watters World" 8:00 p.m. We have the latest on the "Sex Strike", so stay tuned for that. We also have politically incorrect movies that would not survive today. We have a presidential candidate joining us and Dana Perino makes her "Watters World" debut, and you know what we talk about, you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, geez.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We gossip the whole show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I will tune in. Sure people will be riveted.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's a pretty good segment. OK, your turn.

utterances.utterance: All right, "Greg Gutfeld Show" tomorrow May 18th 10:00 p.m. I got Terry Schappert, I got Sean Kanan, I got Kat Timpf and Tyrus - 10 p.m. If you don't watch it you're dead to me. Now it's time for this.

utterances.utterance: Well, talk about walking softly and carrying a big stick check. Check out Bosco, no, he's not a chocolate syrup, he's a dog, a dachshund - a determined dachshund. Check him out with a branch that is so big between his gritty teeth. Look at that little fella go. Just goes to show that big things are often inside small packages. What an adorable little animal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "Animals are Great!"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was so cute.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's what they call the branch manager.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Excellent.

utterances.utterance: Dagen - no, Juan, you're next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Take a look at this video.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: rock-paper-scissors --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Dell and Sonya Curry are the proud parents of two NBA stars. Their son Steph Curry of the champion Golden State Warriors, younger brother Seth of the Portland Trailblazers - the video by the way was done by their daughter. They are the first set of brothers to compete against each other in a Conference Finals Series in NBA history. So the parents wear two-sided jerseys and cheer whichever one of the boys does well. So "Go Curry's Go".

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, that's great. That's great one. Dagen.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I will file this under southern people problems. The Memphis Airport is warning flyers to stop trying to bring large jars and bottles of barbecue sauce on planes in their carry-on bags. Barbecue sauces cannot be transported in your carry-on bags says the sign.

utterances.utterance: Yes, because also if it breaks that's a problem.
